name: KNIME Pharmacophore
tagLine: Use pharmacophores in KNIME workflow
shortStatement: A pharmacophore is an abstract description of molecular features that are necessary for molecular recognition of a ligand by a biological macromolecule. The KNIME nodes in this software allow you to read, write, align pharmacophores.

name: KNIME PLANTS
tagLine: Run PLANTS from KNIME
shortStatement: KNIME nodes to configure, run and analyze PLANTS protein-ligand docking

name: SyGMa
tagLine: Systematic Generation of potential Metabolites
shortStatement: SyGMa provides fast and lightweight predictions of human metabolites to support discovery scientists design better and safer drugs

name: 3D-e-Chem Virtual machine
tagLine: Virtual Machine for Cheminformatics workflows
shortStatement: 3D-e-chem VM is freely available Virtual Machine (VM) encompassing tools, databases & workflows, including new resources developed for ligand binding site comparisons and GPCR research.

name: AHN2 pointcloud viewer
tagLine: LiDAR/PointCloud viewer
shortStatement: WebGL point cloud visualization of AHN2.

name: AMBER
tagLine: Accelerated FRB Real-Time Searching Pipeline
shortStatement: A real-time pipeline to search for Fast Radio Bursts (FRBs) and  other transient radio sources.

name: The Astrophysical Multipurpose Software Environment
tagLine: Multi-physics simulation framework for Astronomy
shortStatement: AMUSE combines existing numerical codes in an easy to use Python framework. With AMUSE you can simulate objects such as star clusters, proto-planetary disks and galaxies.

name: Beyond the book
tagLine: Measuring interest of countries on topics
shortStatement: This scripts measure number of contributions to Wikipedia entries from individuals from different counties.  This can be used as a proxy to measure the cultural bias from a country towards a specific topic.

name: CartoDB Docker image
tagLine: Test drive CartoDB geospatial visualization service
shortStatement: This docker container provides a fully working Cartodb development solution without the installation hassle.

name: Case Law App
tagLine: Case law network visualization
shortStatement: Web application for exploring the citation network of Dutch court decisions.

name: CClusTera
shortStatement: A 3D web tool for interactive visualization of hierarchically clustered big data

name: Cerise
tagLine: Run CWL workflows on HPC resources
shortStatement: Cerise is a service for running  CWL workflows on HPC resources. You add software, tool descriptions, and connection information, then your user runs workflows  whenever they want.

name: Cerise Client
tagLine: Manage and access Cerise from Python
shortStatement: Cerise Client is a Python library for managing and accessing Cerise  workflow execution services. It lets you start and stop services and submit workflows to them.

name: Cesium-ncWMS
tagLine: 3D Globe Visualization of NetCDF data.
shortStatement: Web Application that visualizes NetCDF data in the Cesium 3D open source globe.

name: Chemical Analytics Virtual Machine
shortStatement: Packer template to create Vagrant box with Knime inside

name: Common Sense
shortStatement: User-friendly web application for showing (GIS) data on a map.

name: Compressing-The-Sky project code
tagLine: Statistical compressing of time series
shortStatement: Exploration of time serie compression using statistical properties. This is the code produced in a 6 month pathfinder project.

name: Cross-perspective Topic Modeling
tagLine: Extract topics and opinions from text
shortStatement: Provides insight into topics and opinions and how they change over time.

name: DataVaults
shortStatement: Technology of Attachment to a DBMS of large file repositories.

name: Dedispersion
tagLine: Many-Core Radio Astronomy Dedispersion Library
shortStatement: This library provides easy access to a high-performance, fully tuned radio astronomy dedispersion algorithm.

name: Dive
tagLine: Visualize a large dataset interactively in 3D
shortStatement: If you want to explore your (embedded) data in 3D/2D in the browser,  without installing anything, Dive is the tool for you.

name: Docker Couch Admin
shortStatement: Configures a web service using angular-schema-form and CouchDB

name: eAstroViz
shortStatement: This tool can convert and visualize radio astronomy measurement sets, as well as most LOFAR intermediate data producs. It also does RFI mitigation.

name: eEcology Annotation Tool
shortStatement: Visualize & annotate GPS measurements of bird movements

name: eEcology-SMS-reciever
tagLine: Store SMS messages in a database
shortStatement: If you have birds flying around carrying [UvA-BiTS](http://www.uva-bits.nl/) trackers then this software can save the SMS messages containing the birds last known positions which are send by the tracker into the UvA Bird tracking systems central database.

name: eEcology Tracker calendar
shortStatement: Calendar overview with daily statistics of GPS-tracker

name: Nlesc/Eeg-Epilepsy-Diagnosis: First Release
tagLine: Machine learning for multivariate time series
shortStatement: R package developed to extract features from multivariate time series and feed them into a random forest classifier

name: Embodied Emotions Scripts
tagLine: Historically accurate emotion mining
shortStatement: Identify changes over time in relations between expressions of emotions and body parts in 17th and 18th century Dutch theater texts.

name: PyELSEPA
tagLine: Compute elastic scattering cross-sections
shortStatement: This is a wrapper for ELSEPA, a numeric code by Francesc Salvat, Aleksander Jablonski and Cedric J. Powell, that computes elastic scattering cross-sections for electrons and positrons off neutral atoms.

name: eWaterLeaf
shortStatement: Web-based visualization for the eWaterCycle project

name: FAIR Data Point
tagLine: Make your data assets FAIR
shortStatement: RESTful web service that enables data owners to expose their datasets with rich machine-readable descriptions (metadata), and data users to find data they need for analyses.

name: FastMLC
tagLine: Fast multi-level clustering and visualization
shortStatement: If you want to detect clusters, for example,  in a large collection of DNA or protein sequences, and visualize the results in a web browser then FastMLC is the tool for you.

name: Finding journalists
tagLine: Find interesting persons on Twitter
shortStatement: This tools helps to discover interesting persons on Twitter. We tested it for finding political journalists.

name: frbcat-web
tagLine: Web frontend to the FRB catalogue
shortStatement: frbcat-web provides an easy to browse and filter web frontend to the Fast Radio Burst (FRB) Catalogue. This catalogue contains up to date information for the published population of Fast Radio Bursts.

name: frbcatdb
tagLine: Database for Fast Radio Bursts
shortStatement: frbcatdb provides a relational database interface to Virtual Observation Event (VOEvent) data for analysis and external tools.

name: GoogleEarth Toolbox for MATLAB
shortStatement: Export data from MATLAB to GoogleEarth's KML format.

name: grlc
tagLine: Builds Web APIs using shared SPARQL queries
shortStatement: Accessing triple store data can be cumbersome. grlc allows you to build a web API from SPARQL queries hosted on github.

name: Hadrianus scripts
tagLine: Scripts used in the Hadrianus project
shortStatement: Scripts for Virtuoso to create linked data from relational data, and for creating and using cultural heritage ontologies.

name: HyperCanny
tagLine: Edge-detection in high-dimensional data
shortStatement: Finds edges in high-dimensional (>2) data using the Canny algorithm. The template C++ code works in any number of dimensions and is easily accessible from Python using a Cython wrapper. The Python interface is geared towards applications in climate science.

name: Kernel Tuner
tagLine: Testing and Auto-Tuning GPU code made easy
shortStatement: Kernel Tuner greatly simplifies the development of highly-optimized and auto-tuned CUDA, OpenCL, and C code, supporting many advanced use-cases and optimization strategies that speed up the auto-tuning process

name: KNIME node archetype
tagLine: Maven archetype for KNIME node extension
shortStatement: Want to write your own KNIME node? Then use the KNIME node archetype to generate a node skeleton repository with sample code.

name: KNIME molviewer
tagLine: View 3D Molecules in KNIME workflow
shortStatement: If you are using KNIME workflows with large molecules and you want to view them in 3D then the molviewer nodes are able to handle this.

name: Knime-Testflow
tagLine: Test KNIME workflows from a JUnit test
shortStatement: To  test a KNIME node you developed a test workflow should be run.  This software will allow you to run the workflow in an automated way.

name: Linked Data Platform for Animal Breeding & Genomics
tagLine: Access integrated geno/pheno-typic data
shortStatement: This software provides access to semantically integrated geno-/pheno-typic data and enables the ranking of candidate genes associated with traits of interest in  pig (Sus scrofa).

name: Linked Data Platform for Plant Breeding & Genomics
tagLine: Access integrated geno/pheno-typic data
shortStatement: This software provides access to semantically integrated geno-/pheno-typic data  and enables the ranking of candidate genes associated with traits of interest in tomato species (Solanum lycopersicum and pennellii).

name: MAGMa
tagLine: Automated annotation of multi-stage mass spectrometry data
shortStatement: MAGMa is an online application for the automatic chemical annotation of accurate multistage MSn spectral data.

name: Massive-PotreeConverter
tagLine: Distributed sorting and re-organization of pointcloud data for efficient visualization
shortStatement: Distributed generation of massive multi-resolution octrees (required by Potree-based renderers).

name: mcfly
tagLine: Deep learning for time series
shortStatement: Do you want to use deep learning on your time series data, but don't know where to start? mcfly helps you find a suitable model, building upon state-of-the-art deep learning research.

name: MDStudio
tagLine: Molecular Dynamics workflows made easy
shortStatement: MDStudio provides biochemistry researchers in science and industry with the easiest and most flexible solution to running  molecular dynamics-based workflows. It is community-developed open source software.

name: MMSODA Toolbox for MATLAB
tagLine: MATLAB toolbox for optimization and state estimation
shortStatement: MATLAB toolbox for global optimization and state estimation of dynamic models using distributed computing

name: nlppln
tagLine: Easily combine NLP tools
shortStatement: For text mining researchers that want to build workflows, nlppln is the most flexible solution among NLP toolkits, because it allows you to quickly combine tools from different sources.

name: Noodles
tagLine: Parallel programming in Python
shortStatement: Task-based parallel programming model in Python. Run complex workflows on large computer clusters or parallelize codes on your laptop: Noodles offers the same intuitive interface.

name: ochre
tagLine: Practical tools for OCR post-correction
shortStatement: Clean up (historical) OCR text with ochre. Because ochre corrects words in context, it naturally deals with word boundary errors and real word errors.

name: OCTSEG
tagLine: Convenient GUI for OCT image segmentaiton
shortStatement: If you are a researcher analyzing retinal optical coherence tomography (OCT) images,  OCTSegmentaion is the graphical segmentation tool for you

name: The Oceanographic Multipurpose Software Environment
tagLine: Multi-physics simulation environment for Climate Sciences
shortStatement: OMUSE interfaces oceanographic and other earth system model codes in an homogeneous Python environment.

name: Osmium
shortStatement: Want to run command line executables by talking to a generic web service, then osmium can do that for you.

name: PattyAnalytics
shortStatement: Reusable point cloud analytics software (segmentation, registration, file format conversion)

name: Via Appia Visualization
tagLine: WebGL pointcloud visualization of the Via Appia
shortStatement: A web application which visualizes the point clouds and additional data gathered in the Via Appia project with  WebGL.

name: PIDIMEHS library
tagLine: Interactive exploration of historical newspaper archives
shortStatement: Showcases a diachronic analysis of the Dutch Royal Library's newspaper archive, answering questions about Dutch 20th century cultural and political segregation. Combines Pandas, Jupyter Notebooks and other PyData stack tools with ElasticSearch.

name: python-pcl
shortStatement: Python bindings to Point Cloud Library (PCL)

name: PyXenon
tagLine: Easier access to compute and storage
shortStatement: Python wrapper for the Xenon programming interface to various compute and storage resources.

name: QMflows
tagLine: Workflows automation in quantum chemistry
shortStatement: This library tackles the construction and efficient execution of computational chemistry workflows. This allows researchers to use massively parallel compute environments in an easy manner and focus on interpretation of scientific data rather than on tedious job submission procedures and manual data processing.

name: QTL TableMiner++
tagLine: Access QTL information burried in literature
shortStatement: Quantitative trait locus (QTL) mapping  experiments are commonly described in scientific literature but the results presented in tables are difficult to re-use. QTL TableMiner++ enables to make these results available in machine-readable formats.

name: ReGIS
tagLine: Interactive visualization of spatial data
shortStatement: A virtual laboratory for researchers and urban planning officials to visualize, analyze and explore spatial data and model results.

name: Rig
shortStatement: Big data cleaning toolkit

name: RooFit
shortStatement: The Toolkit for Data Modeling with ROOT allows for modeling probability distributions in a compact and abstract way.

name: Sagecal
tagLine: Distributed GPU-accelerated calibration for radio-interferometric data.
shortStatement: Sagecal is the tool for radio astronomers that need many GPU accelerated compute nodes to calibrate interferometric datasets, for hundreds of directions on the sky simultaneously.

name: SalientDetector-python
tagLine: Detection of salient regions in images - Python
shortStatement: If you want to automate your image analysis tasks such as object detection or photo-identification in an easy way with free open-source software, the SalientDetector-Python is the tool for you

name: SalientDescriptor-matlab
tagLine: Matching of salient regions in images - MATLAB
shortStatement: If you need to automate your image analysis tasks such as image matching for the purposes of object detection or photo-identification in an easy way with open software, the SalientDescriptor-MATLAB is right for you

name: SalientDetector-matlab
tagLine: Detection of salient regions in images - MATLAB
shortStatement: If you want to automate your image analysis tasks such as object detection or photo-identification in an easy way with open software, the SalientDetector-MATLAB is right for you

name: scriptcwl
tagLine: Easy CWL workflow creation using Python
shortStatement: For Python programmers that want to create CWL workflows, scriptcwl is the easiest to use among all workflow creation tools, because it is already familiar.

name: Structure-From-Motion
shortStatement: Structure from Motion pipeline (from images to point clouds)

name: Emma
tagLine: Emma is a project to create a platform for development of application for Spark and DockerSwarm clusters.
shortStatement: Emma is a project to create a platform for development of application for Spark and DockerSwarm clusters. The platform runs on an infra-structure composed by virtual machines and Ansible playbooks are used to create a storage layer, processing layer and JupyterHub services. The storage layer offers two flavors of storage, file-base by GlusterFS and Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS), and object-based using Minio. The processing layer has a Apache Spark cluster and a Docker Swarm sharing the storage instances.

name: Shifting Concepts Through Time (ShiCo)
tagLine: Explore temporal concept shift using word2vec
shortStatement: ShiCo is a tool for visualizing time shifting concepts. We refer to a concept as the set of words which are related to a given seed word. ShiCo uses a set of semantic models (word2vec) spanning a number of years to explore how concepts change over time -- words related to a given concept at time t=0 may differ from the words related to the same concept at time t=n.

name: SIGA.py
tagLine: Generate semantically interoperable genome annotations
shortStatement: SIGA.py is a  light-weight tool to generate semantically interoperable genome annotations in RDF formats.

name: SPOT
tagLine: Interactive visual data analytics tool
shortStatement: SPOT is an interactive visualization tool for multi-dimensional data. It allows quick analysis of complex datasets and easy identification of  correlations between variables.

name: StoryTeller
tagLine: Information visualization of complex Humanities data
shortStatement: StoryTeller is a web application for visual analysis of textual data which can show you the connections between storylines, participants and other entities in complex humanities data.

name: One button compute
tagLine: Run same workflow on many files
shortStatement: If you a have a bunch of files you need to run the same CWL workflow on then the One Button Compute web application is the tool for you.

name: Texcavator
tagLine: Visualize search results
shortStatement: Texcavator is a search engine and text mining application for creating word cloud and time line visualizations of large text corpora.

name: TwiNL: website code
tagLine: Access to Dutch tweet statistics
shortStatement: Software behind the web server twiqs.nl, only useful in combination with the TwiNL crawler software

name: twiqs.nl
tagLine: Access to Dutch tweet statistics
shortStatement: Web server twiqs.nl provides free access to statistics about Dutch tweets since 2010

name: GGIR
tagLine: wearable acceleration sensor data analysis tool
shortStatement: Turns raw movement sensor data into insightful reports for physical activity and sleep researchers. The package has been developed and tested for binary data from GENEActiv and GENEA devices, .csv-export data from Actigraph devices, and .cwa and .wav-format data from Axivity. These devices are currently widely used in research on human daily physical activity.

name: Xenon
tagLine: Easy access to compute and storage
shortStatement: If you are using remote machines to do your computations, and don’t feel like learning and implementing many different APIs, Xenon is the tool for you.

name: Xenon command line interface
tagLine: Easy access to compute and storage from the command line
shortStatement: If you are using remote machines to do your computations, and don’t feel like learning and implementing many different APIs and do no not want to program, Xenon Command Line Interface (CLI) is the tool for you.

name: Xenon gRPC
tagLine: Easy access to compute and storage as a service
shortStatement: If you are using remote machines to do your computations, and don’t feel like learning and implementing many different APIs and do not want to program in Java, Xenon gRPC is the tool for you.

name: boatswain
tagLine: Build Docker dependencies the easy way
shortStatement: Boatswain is a simple build system for docker images. It is especially useful when you have multiple docker images that depend on each other.

name: Research Software Directory
tagLine: Encouraging the re-use of research software
shortStatement: The Research Software Directory aims to promote the impact, the exchange and re-use of research software.
